revised_title: Improvements in Dipping Needle Instruments for Measuring Terrestrial Magnetism
tldr: Samuel Hunter Christie proposes improvements to the instruments and methods used to determine the direction and intensity of terrestrial magnetism. He suggests a new design for the dipping needle that eliminates the need to invert its poles, allowing for more accurate and faster measurements. Additionally, this design allows for the simultaneous measurement of both the dip and the terrestrial magnetic intensity, reducing the need for additional observations.
